name: Entrenchment (ER)
functionStatement: Frequent overbank flows reduce flood peaks, support riparian vegetation, create off-channel refugia, and extend nutrient processing time.
descriptionMarkdown: Channel is not deeply incised; moderate floods access a broad floodplain, matching reference conditions.

levels.label: Strongly Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Channel is walled or deeply incised with little widening at flood-prone elevation.
Criteria: ER near 1.0 and confinement by levees or walls.

levels.label: Disagree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Three cross-sections yield ER ~ 1.2.
Criteria: ER < 1.4.

levels.label: Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: Representative cross-section yields ER ~ 1.7.
Criteria: ER ~1.4-2.2.

levels.label: Strongly Agree
levels.criteriaMarkdown:
Observation: LiDAR cross-sections show flood-prone width more than 2.2 times bankfull width.
Criteria: ER > 2.2.
